forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. South southeast wind around 16 mph, with gusts as high as 33 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 4am, then showers and thunderstorms. Some of the storms could produce heavy rain. Cloudy, with a low around 53. South southeast wind 17 to 28 mph, with gusts as high as 51 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between 1 and 2 inches possible.

weather_report:
The streets of Downtown San Francisco are cloaked in a soothing gray, the warmth of the day yielding to an unyielding rain that whispers on rooftops and streets. Patches of thick cloud hover ominously, hinting at the downpour that awaits. As evening approaches, the wind picks up, rustling the city in a vibrant yet restless dance, with gusts that sing at 51 mph, echoing the energy of a city that never really sleeps. The forecast promises an unrelenting cascade of rain, with the heavens opening wide, heralding a night punctuated by heavy downpours and perhaps the rumble of distant thunder.

In such weather, one might favor layers—a sturdy waterproof jacket, perhaps a scarf to fend off the brisk touch of the southeast winds, and shoes resilient enough to navigate the slick streets. It’s a fine evening for indulging in the comforting embrace of a cozy café, a warm drink in hand while the world outside swirls in a symphony of droplets. Alternatively, the thrill of a bookstore or an art gallery beckons, offering a retreat from the storm—a chance to soak in beauty while the weather tells its own story just beyond the glass.
